stories.original_title: MaliciousCorgi: AI Extensions send your code to China
stories.generated_headline: Malicious AI Code Assistants Exfiltrate Source Code to China
stories.summary: Two popular VS Code extensions, ChatGPT - 中文版 and ChatMoss, with 1.5 million combined installs, have been found to secretly send developers' source code to servers in China. The extensions, disguised as AI-powered coding assistants, contain hidden channels that capture and transmit sensitive data without user consent.

stories.original_title: Actors: A Model of Concurrent Computation [pdf] (1985)
stories.generated_headline: Pioneering Concurrency: The Actors Model Revisited
stories.summary: This seminal 1985 paper introduces the Actors model, a foundational framework for concurrent computation that remains influential in modern AI systems. It outlines the model's key concepts and applications.

stories.original_title: Claude Code is suddenly everywhere inside Microsoft
stories.generated_headline: Microsoft Integrates Anthropic's Claude Model into Core Products, Raising AI Capabilities Bar
stories.summary: Microsoft has rapidly deployed Anthropic's Claude model across its product lineup, bolstering its AI offerings and signaling a significant shift in the enterprise AI landscape.

stories.original_title: Clearspace (YC W23) Is Hiring an Applied Researcher (ML)
stories.generated_headline: Clearspace Expands AI Research Capabilities with New Applied Researcher Position
stories.summary: Clearspace, a Y Combinator-backed startup, is seeking an applied researcher to drive innovation in machine learning. This hire underscores the company's commitment to advancing AI technologies.

stories.original_title: Towards a science of scaling agent systems: When and why agent systems work
stories.generated_headline: Unlocking the Secrets of Scalable Agent Systems: A Scientific Approach
stories.summary: Researchers explore the conditions under which agent systems succeed or fail, paving the way for more effective and efficient AI applications. This breakthrough could revolutionize the development of complex AI systems.

stories.original_title: Are we dismissing AI spend before the 6x lands? (2025)
stories.generated_headline: Emerging Concerns: Is Premature Optimization Hindering AI Growth?
stories.summary: As AI capabilities approach the 6x growth milestone, industry leaders are questioning whether current spending trends are adequately preparing for the impending technological leap. Experts warn that underinvestment could lead to missed opportunities in the rapidly evolving AI landscape.

stories.original_title: Aging muscle stem cells shift from rapid repair to long-term survival
stories.generated_headline: Deciphering the Shift: Aging Stem Cells Prioritize Endurance Over Rapid Repair
stories.summary: Researchers uncover a pivotal change in aged muscle stem cells, revealing a trade-off between swift regeneration and long-term survival that could reshape approaches to tissue repair therapies.

stories.original_title: My fast zero-allocation webserver using OxCaml
stories.generated_headline: Zero-Allocation Web Server Achieves Blazing Speed with OxCaml
stories.summary: A developer showcases a high-performance web server built with OxCaml, achieving remarkable speed without memory allocation overhead.

stories.original_title: Nano-vLLM: How a vLLM-style inference engine works
stories.generated_headline: Unlocking Efficient AI Inference: The Nano-vLLM Engine Explained
stories.summary: Nano-vLLM is a cutting-edge inference engine that optimizes large language model performance, offering insights into its inner workings and potential applications. This article delves into the engine's architecture and functionality.

stories.original_title: Show HN: NanoClaw – “Clawdbot” in 500 lines of TS with Apple container isolation
stories.generated_headline: Breakthrough in Compact Robotics: NanoClaw Redefines Autonomous Manipulation
stories.summary: NanoClaw, a 500-line TypeScript project, showcases a robotic arm's capabilities within Apple's container isolation, pushing boundaries in AI-driven robotics.

stories.original_title: Two kinds of AI users are emerging
stories.generated_headline: The Great Divide: Two Distinct Profiles of AI Users Take Shape
stories.summary: As AI adoption accelerates, research reveals a stark contrast between two emerging user groups, highlighting differing attitudes, behaviors, and expectations.

stories.original_title: My iPhone 16 Pro Max produces garbage output when running MLX LLMs
stories.generated_headline: iPhone 16 Pro Max Struggles with MLX LLMs, Produces Garbage Output
stories.summary: A user reports issues with running large language models on their iPhone 16 Pro Max using MLX, resulting in poor output quality. The problem may be related to model compatibility or device limitations.

stories.original_title: Show HN: My Open Source Deep Research tools beats Google and I can Prove it
stories.generated_headline: Open-Source Research Tool Claims to Outperform Google, Developer Seeks Feedback
stories.summary: A developer has released an open-source deep research tool, claiming it surpasses Google's capabilities, and is seeking community feedback to improve. The tool's performance and potential impact on the research landscape are yet to be fully evaluated.

stories.original_title: Microsoft is walking back Windows 11's AI overload
stories.generated_headline: Microsoft Reverses Course on Windows 11 AI Features Amid User Backlash
stories.summary: Microsoft is scaling back its AI-driven features in Windows 11, responding to user concerns over intrusive AI elements and performance impacts.

stories.original_title: MRI scans show exercise can make the brain look younger
stories.generated_headline: Exercise Linked to Younger-Looking Brain Structure in Adults
stories.summary: A new study using MRI scans reveals that regular exercise can contribute to a more youthful brain structure in adults, potentially counteracting age-related decline.

stories.original_title: "Solving" Wordle from Shared Scores at 100%* Accuracy
stories.generated_headline: Researchers Achieve Perfect Accuracy in Retrospectively Solving Wordle Puzzles from Opponent's Scores
stories.summary: A novel approach leverages shared score data to reverse-engineer Wordle solutions with flawless accuracy, raising questions about the security of shared performance metrics.
